questions: Q. 1. Name the tissue which is responsible for increase in length of stem and root.
Q. 2. Name the four elements of phloem.
answers: Ans. Sieve tubes, companion cells, phloem parenchyma and phloem fibres.

questions: Q. 3. What are the types of complex permanent tissues ?
Q. 4. Name the two types of plant tissues.
answers: Ans. Meristematic tissue and permanent tissue.
Ans. Meristematic tissue is capable of dividing and is found in the developing regions of the plant.

questions: Q. 6. How many types of meristematic tissues are there on the basis of their presence ?
answers: Ans. Three namely—apical, lateral  and intercalary. 1 Mark each

questions: Q. 7. What do you understand by differentiation ?
answers: Ans. When meristematic tissues lose their ability to divide and become permanent in shape, size and function, the process is called differentiation.

questions: Q. 8. How is permanent tissue formed from meristematic tissue ?
answers: Ans. When the cells take up a specific role and lose their ability to divide.

questions: Q. 9. What is source of cork ?
answers: Ans. Cork is obtained from the bark of a tree i.e., oak plant’s stem.
Ans. Stomata are the small pores present in the epidermis of leaf.

questions: Q. 11. What do you mean by guard cells ?
answers: Ans. Stomata are enclosed by two kidney-shaped cells which are called guard cells.

questions: Q. 12. Name the complex plant tissues.

answers: Ans. Vascular bundles consist of xylem and phloem. 1 TISSUES, ORGANS, ORGAN SYSTEM, ORGANISM

questions: Q. 14. What is the function of cutin, the waxy substance present in epidermis of desert plants ?
answers: Ans. Cutin checks loss of water in desert plants.

questions: Q. 15. Water Hyacinth floats on water surface. Explain.
answers: Ans. Water Hyacinth has spongy petioles which enclose a lot of air in its aerenchyma. Air makes the plant lighter than water and so it is able to float on the surface of water.

questions: Q. 16. Why is cork impervious to gases and water ?
answers: Ans. Cork is impervious due to a chemical called suberin.
